sen.j: 藤原 行経（ふじわら の ゆきつね、寛弘9年（1012年） - 永承5年閏10月14日 (旧暦)（1050年11月30日））は、平安時代中期の公卿・能書家。
sen.e: Fujiwara no Yukitsune (1012 - 30th November 1050) was a cout noble and calligrapher who lived during the mid-Heian period.
Fujiwara no Yukitsune (1012 - 30th November 1050) was a cout noble and calligrapher who lived during the mid-Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Yukitsune (1012 - November 30, 1050) was a court noble and calligrapher who lived during the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 大納言藤原行成の三男。
sen.e: He was the third son of Daiagon (chief councillor of state) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.
He was the third son of Daiagon (chief councillor of state) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.
He was the third son of Dainagon (chief councillor of state) FUJIWARA no Yukinari.

sen.j: 従二位・参議・兵部卿。
sen.e: He was held the rank of junii (junior second rank) and served as sangi (councillor) and hyobukyo (Minister of Hyobusho Ministry of Military).
He was held the rank of junii (junior second rank) and served as sangi (councillor) and hyobukyo (Minister of Hyobusho Ministry of Military).
He was held the rank of Junii (junior second rank) and served as Sangi (councillor) and Hyobukyo (Minister of Hyobusho Ministry of Military).

sen.j: 和様書道の流派世尊寺流二代目。
sen.e: He was the second head of the Sesonji School of Japanese calligraphy.
He was the second head of the Sesonji School of Japanese calligraphy.
He was the second head of the Sesonji School of Japanese calligraphy.
Works Attributed to Fujiwara no Yukitsune
Works Attributed to Fujiwara no Yukitsune
Works attributed to FUJIWARA no Yukitsune
sen.cmt: 文頭のみ大文字人名修正

sen.j: 高野切 ※この切の第一種は彼の真筆であるとされる説もある。
sen.e: Koya-gire: There is a theory that the first type of this work was written by Fujiwara no Yukitsune.
Koya-gire: There is a theory that the first type of this work was written by Fujiwara no Yukitsune.
Koya-gire: There is a theory that the first type of this work was written by FUJIWARA no Yukitsune.
